lead_paragraph: The agency said on Friday that 122 of the women are from Puerto Rico, where the mosquito-borne virus is most common so far in the United States.

headline.print_headline: C.D.C. Is Monitoring 279 Pregnant Women for Possible Zika Infections
headline.main: C.D.C. Is Monitoring 279 Pregnant Women With Possible Zika Virus Infections

snippet: The agency said on Friday that 122 of the women are from Puerto Rico, where the mosquito-borne virus is most common so far in the United States.
abstract: Federal health officials announce they are monitoring 279 pregnant women in United States and its territories who have been infected or are suspected of being infected with Zika virus; World Health Organization separately confirms strain of Zika in Cape Verde is same strain spreading in Brazil.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
